text: Prepare the jars and lids prior to starting the recipe. Wash them in the dishwasher and allow to air dry. If you don't have a dishwasher, boil them for quarter of an hour in a large saucepan. Prepare the pears. Peel each pore and core it. Slice each pear thinly. Pour the fruit, sugar, wine, water cinnamon sticks, minced ginger and clove bag into the saucepan or stock pot. Bring to the boil over a medium to high heat. Cook the mixture until it reaches 220 °F (104 °C). This will take around three quarters of an hour. Remove from the heat. Transfer the fruit into the sterilized jars, using a slotted spoon. Using the back of a spoon, press down on the fruit. This will both even out the fruit and help it to settle by pressing out air bubbles. Press a cinnamon stick into each jar. Pour the hot syrup to fill each jar. Seal the jars and leave to stand for a day. Store until needed. Enjoy eating the preserve. This goes well with cereal, over ice cream, or as a pudding sauce. Use current canning practices to make this recipe.  Finished.
